# Stay Current with AI

## Description
A systematic approach to staying updated with rapidly evolving AI tools, models, and development practices.

## The AI Landscape (January 2026)

### Major Players
1. **GitHub Copilot** (Your primary tool)
   - Owner: Microsoft/GitHub
   - Models: GPT-4, Claude 3.5 Sonnet
   - Features: Code completion, chat, agents, workspace indexing

2. **Cursor** (Alternative IDE)
   - AI-first code editor
   - Built on VS Code
   - Advanced context awareness

3. **Claude** (Anthropic)
   - Best for long context
   - Strong reasoning
   - Excellent for code review

4. **ChatGPT** (OpenAI)
   - GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo
   - Code interpreter
   - Custom GPTs

5. **Codeium** (Free alternative)
   - Free Copilot alternative
   - Multiple IDEs
   - Growing community

## Daily Information Sources

### Must-Read (Daily - 15 min)
1. **GitHub Changelog**
   - URL: https://github.blog/changelog/
   - Filter: Copilot updates
   - Time: 5 min/day

2. **Hacker News**
   - URL: https://news.ycombinator.com
   - Filter: "AI" "Copilot" "LLM"
   - Time: 5 min/day

3. **Twitter/X Lists**
   ```
   Follow these accounts:
   @GitHubCopilot    (Official updates)
   @code              (VS Code team)
   @OpenAI           (ChatGPT updates)
   @AnthropicAI      (Claude updates)
   @simonw           (AI insights)
   @karpathy         (AI fundamentals)
   ```
   Time: 5 min/day

### Weekly Deep Dives (Weekly - 1 hour)

1. **Monday: Newsletter Review**
   ```
   TLDR AI          ‚Üí General AI news
   Import AI        ‚Üí Technical deep dives
   The Batch        ‚Üí Andrew Ng's newsletter
   GitHub Universe  ‚Üí Developer updates
   ```

2. **Wednesday: YouTube Channels**
   ```
   Fireship         ‚Üí Quick tech news
   Theo - t3.gg    ‚Üí Web dev + AI
   Code Report      ‚Üí Weekly summary
   GitHub           ‚Üí Official tutorials
   ```

3. **Friday: Blog Posts**
   ```
   Microsoft DevBlogs ‚Üí Official updates
   Vercel Blog        ‚Üí AI in web dev
   OpenAI Blog        ‚Üí Research updates
   Anthropic Blog     ‚Üí Claude updates
   ```

### Monthly Learning (Monthly - 4 hours)

1. **First Week: New Features**
   - Try new Copilot features
   - Test new models
   - Update workflows

2. **Second Week: Community**
   - Check awesome-copilot updates
   - Explore new agents
   - Join discussions

3. **Third Week: Projects**
   - Build with new tools
   - Share learnings
   - Get feedback

4. **Fourth Week: Teaching**
   - Write about what you learned
   - Create agents/skills
   - Help others

## Information Filters

### What to Prioritize
‚úÖ Official release notes (GitHub, VS Code)
‚úÖ Hands-on tutorials and demos
‚úÖ Breaking changes and migrations
‚úÖ New features with practical use
‚úÖ Community best practices
‚úÖ Performance improvements

### What to Skip
‚ùå Hype without substance
‚ùå Theoretical papers (unless researching)
‚ùå Duplicate news (same story, multiple sources)
‚ùå Tool wars and comparisons
‚ùå Features not relevant to your stack

## Learning System

### 1. Capture
Use a simple note system:
```
Date: 2026-01-12
Source: GitHub Changelog
Topic: New Copilot Agent Features
Status: To Try

Notes:
- Agents can now access MCP servers
- New @workspace indexing improvements
- Better context window management

Action: Try building agent with MCP
```

### 2. Process (Weekly)
Review notes and categorize:
- **Now**: Urgent, affects current work
- **Next**: Important, schedule time
- **Later**: Interesting, reference later
- **Archive**: Good to know, no action

### 3. Practice (Immediately)
Don't just read, DO:
```
Learn about feature ‚Üí 
  Test in sandbox ‚Üí 
    Apply to project ‚Üí 
      Share learning ‚Üí
        Teach others
```

### 4. Share (Weekly)
- Tweet about new feature
- Create example agent
- Update your workflows
- Help someone else learn

## Tools for Staying Current

### RSS Feeds
Use an RSS reader (Feedly, Inoreader):
```
Add these feeds:
- GitHub Blog: https://github.blog/feed/
- VS Code Updates: https://code.visualstudio.com/feed.xml
- Hacker News AI: https://hnrss.org/newest?q=AI
```

### GitHub Watch
Star and watch these repos:
```
github/copilot-docs
microsoft/vscode

awesome-copilot (you have this!)
```

### Discord/Slack Communities
Join these communities:
```

```

### Podcasts (Passive Learning)
Listen while commuting:
```
Practical AI          (Weekly)
The TWIML AI Podcast  (Weekly)

```

## Hands-On Practice Schedule

### Daily (30 min)
```
1. Morning: Check updates (10 min)
2. Lunch: Try one new thing (10 min)
3. Evening: Document learning (10 min)
```

### Weekly (3 hours)
```
1. Deep dive on major update (1 hour)
2. Build small project with new feature (1.5 hours)
3. Share and discuss (30 min)
```

### Monthly (8 hours)
```
1. Complete new course/tutorial (4 hours)
2. Build significant project (3 hours)
3. Write blog/create agent (1 hour)
```

## Benchmarking Progress

### Every 3 Months, Assess:
```
Knowledge Level (1-10):
- Current AI tools: __
- GitHub Copilot: __
- VS Code ecosystem: __
- Prompt engineering: __
- Agent development: __

Practical Skills (Projects Completed):
- With new features: __
- Shared with community: __
- Teaching materials created: __

Impact (Measurable):
- Time saved: __hours/week
- Code quality: __% improvement
- Learning speed: __x faster
```

## Warning Signs You're Falling Behind

üö® Haven't tried a new Copilot feature in 2+ weeks
üö® Don't understand latest changelog updates
üö® Your workflows haven't evolved in a month
üö® Community discusses features you don't know
üö® New developers know techniques you don't

## Recovery Plan

If you fall behind:
```
Week 1: STOP
- Pause new learning
- Review last 4 weeks of updates
- Make list of what matters

Week 2: FOCUS
- Pick top 3 important updates
- Deep dive only those
- Ignore everything else

Week 3: PRACTICE
- Build with new knowledge
- Update workflows
- Test in real projects

Week 4: RESUME
- Return to normal schedule
- Don't try to catch up on everything
- Stay current from this point
```

## Learning Velocity

### Beginner Phase (Months 1-3)
- Focus: Fundamentals
- Time: 1-2 hours/day
- Goal: Understand core tools

### Intermediate Phase (Months 4-6)
- Focus: Advanced features
- Time: 1 hour/day
- Goal: Build complex projects

### Advanced Phase (Months 7-12)
- Focus: Innovation
- Time: 30-60 min/day
- Goal: Create and teach

### Expert Phase (Year 2+)
- Focus: Leadership
- Time: 30 min/day
- Goal: Shape the field

## The Meta Skill

The most important skill is **learning to learn faster**:
```
1. Identify what's important (signal vs noise)
2. Learn just enough to apply
3. Apply immediately to real work
4. Reflect on what worked
5. Share to reinforce
6. Repeat daily
```

Remember: In AI, staying current isn't about knowing everything‚Äîit's about knowing what matters, learning it quickly, and applying it effectively. Focus on fundamentals, practice daily, and teach others.
